\section{Inputs from observers}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:inputs-from-observers}}

\subsection{Proposal\sphinxhyphen{}related information}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:proposal-related-information}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The following information is required for each \sphinxstyleemphasis{proposal}.


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabulary}{\linewidth}[t]{|T|T|T|T|T|}

\sphinxAtStartPar

&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
default
\\

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{proposal\_id}}
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
str
&
\sphinxAtStartPar

&
\sphinxAtStartPar
*
&
\sphinxAtStartPar

\subsubsection{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:notes}}

\paragraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{tract}}, \sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{patch}}}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:tract-patch}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If the look\sphinxhyphen{}up \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tract}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{patch}} from the coordinates is not expensive, it is possible for the observatory to automatically fill these information without asking inputs from observers.


\paragraph{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{input\_catalog}}}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:input-catalog}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, the following catalogs are considered, and the list can be easily expanded.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{input\PYGZus{}catalog\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{input\PYGZus{}catalog\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{input\PYGZus{}catalog\PYGZus{}description}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{0}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{simulated}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{simulated catalog}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{gaia\PYGZus{}dr1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Gaia Data Release 1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{gaia\PYGZus{}dr2}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Gaia Data Release 2}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{gaia\PYGZus{}edr3}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Gaia Early Data Release 3}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{gaia\PYGZus{}dr3}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Gaia Data Release 3}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr1\PYGZus{}wide}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 1 (Wide)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr1\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 1 (Deep+UltraDeep)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{7}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr2\PYGZus{}wide}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 2 (Wide)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{8}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr2\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 2 (Deep+UltraDeep)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{9}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr3\PYGZus{}wide}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 3 (Wide)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{10}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr3\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 3 (Deep+UltraDeep)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{11}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr4\PYGZus{}wide}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 4 (Wide)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{12}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr4\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HSC\PYGZhy{}SSP Public Data Release 4 (Deep+UltraDeep)}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For individual proposals, either assigning a new \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{input\_catalog\_id}} (e.g., s22a\sphinxhyphen{}qn0001\_00001 with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{input\_catalog\_id=10001}}) or allow them to use pre\sphinxhyphen{}assigned \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{input\_catalog}} should work.


\section{Inputs from the observatory}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:inputs-from-the-observatory}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
In the background, the observatory needs to populate the rest of tables such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{proposal\_category}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{proposal}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{target\_type}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{input\_catalog}}, and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fluxstd}}.


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{proposal\_category}}}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:proposal-category}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{proposal\_category}} contains the following information.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{proposal\PYGZus{}category\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{proposal\PYGZus{}category\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{proposal\PYGZus{}category\PYGZus{}description}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{openuse}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Subaru openuse proposal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{keck}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Subaru/Keck time exchange proposal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{gemini}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Subaru/Gemini time exchange proposal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{uh}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{University of Hawaii proposal}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{target\_type}}}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:target-type}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{target\_type}} contains teh following entries as defined by the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/Subaru-PFS/datamodel/blob/master/datamodel.txt}{datamodel}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{target\PYGZus{}type\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{target\PYGZus{}type\PYGZus{}name}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{n}{target\PYGZus{}type\PYGZus{}description}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SCIENCE}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber is intended to be on a science target}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{2}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SKY}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber is intended to be on blank sky, and used for sky subtraction}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{FLUXSTD}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber is intended to be on a flux standard, and used for flux calibration}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{UNASSIGNED}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber is not targeted on anything in particular}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{5}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ENGINEERING}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber is an engineering fiber}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SUNSS\PYGZus{}IMAGING}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber goes to the SuNSS imaging leg}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{l+m+mi}{7}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{SUNSS\PYGZus{}DIFFUSE}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{the fiber goes to the SuNSS diffuse leg}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{proposal}}}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:proposal}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{proposal}} table’s schema is the following.


\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\centering
\begin{tabulary}{\linewidth}[t]{|T|T|T|T|T|}

\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\subsection{Other tables}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:other-tables}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
There are more tables which are still under development such as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sky}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cluster}}.


\section{File format}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:file-format}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
As a target list contains proposal\sphinxhyphen{}specific and target\sphinxhyphen{}specific information, a file format which can handle metadata would be preferable.

\sphinxAtStartPar
A couple of candidates can be recommended.
\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
FITS binary table

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
ECSV (Enhanced CSV)

\end{enumerate}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Both can be easily prepared with Astropy.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:example}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Prepare a list for targets.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{astropy}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{table} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Table}
\PYG{n}{tb} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Table}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{42687868933508256}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{42687868933508552}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{351.32788192091937}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{351.2784400775651}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.713249785705446}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.7191567004328004}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{J2000.0}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{J2000.0}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{9706}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{9706}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mi}{304}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{304}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr3\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hscssp\PYGZus{}pdr3\PYGZus{}dud}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+m+mf}{900.0}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{900.0}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{names}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{obj\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{ra}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{dec}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{epoch}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{tract}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{patch}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{input\PYGZus{}catalog}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{priority}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
                   \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{effective\PYGZus{}exptime}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{,}
            \PYG{n}{meta}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{proposal\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{S22A\PYGZhy{}QN001}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
If you have a similar list as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pandas.DataFrame}}, the following should work.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{tb} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Table}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{from\PYGZus{}pandas}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{df}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{tb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{meta}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{proposal\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{S22A\PYGZhy{}QN001}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
You can save the object into a file.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{tb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{targets\PYGZus{}s22a\PYGZhy{}qn001.fits}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{format}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{fits}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{tb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{write}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{targets\PYGZus{}s22a\PYGZhy{}qn001.ecsv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n+nb}{format}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ascii.ecsv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Reading the data is easy.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{tb2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Table}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{read}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{targets\PYGZus{}s22a\PYGZhy{}qn001.fits}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{tb2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Table}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{read}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{targets\PYGZus{}s22a\PYGZhy{}qn001.ecsv}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{tb2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{meta}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{proposal\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{]}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{tb2}\PYG{p}{)}

\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Notes on future development}
\label{\detokenize{input_target_list:notes-on-future-development}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Currently, only creating entries in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{targetDB}} is tested. Updating and removing them need to be implemented in the future.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Also, the script/function to create entries is still as of the 2021 November commissioning. This will be modified accordingly.

\end{itemize}

\label{\detokenize{index:indices-and-tables}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{modindex}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\DUrole{xref,std,std-ref}{search}

\end{itemize}
